297: JOB PURPOSEThe Payroll Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing the company's payroll operations, ensuring accurate and timely processing of employee salaries, wages, bonuses, and benefits in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The role requires a thorough understanding of payroll systems and processes, as well as strong leadership and communication skills to manage a team of payroll professionals.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES* Oversee the entire payroll process, ensuring accurate and timely payroll processing, tax filing, and compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.* Lead a team of payroll professionals, providing guidance and training as needed to ensure timely and accurate completion of all payroll-related tasks.* Manage relationships with external payroll service providers, including ADP, to ensure seamless integration and accuracy in payroll processing.* Work collaboratively with HR, finance, and other departments to ensure timely and accurate processing of payroll-related data and information.* Stay up to date on changes in payroll laws and regulations, adjusting payroll policies and procedures as necessary to ensure compliance.* Identify areas for process improvement and implement new payroll systems and technologies as needed to streamline payroll processing and improve accuracy.* Develop and maintain payroll-related policies and procedures, ensuring consistency and adherence to best practices.* Prepare and distribute payroll reports to management and other stakeholders as needed* Oversee the preparation and filing of payroll-related reports, such as quarter and year end-tax returns, and W-2s.* Review and analyze payroll data to identify and resolve errors, discrepancies, and other issues, ensuring accuracy and completeness of records* Develop and implement payroll policies and procedures to improve efficiency and effectiveness of payroll operationsMAY PERFORM OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNEDDISCLAIMERThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE* Demonstrates enthusiasm and commitment toward the job and the mission of the company; supports company's goals and strategic priorities.* Knowledge of Payroll Systems: You should have a deep understanding of payroll systems, including experience with payroll software such as ADP, Paychex, or Kronos. You should also be able to handle the data entry and other aspects of running payroll, such as tracking employee hours, calculating taxes, and processing benefits.* Communication Skills: You would need to communicate regularly with employees, managers, and other stakeholders, so excellent communication skills are essential. You should be able to explain complex payroll-related issues in simple terms and be comfortable presenting to large groups.* Management Skills: You would be responsible for leading a team of payroll administrators, so you should have strong management skills. This includes the ability to delegate tasks, provide guidance and support, and manage performance.* Analytical Skills: You should have strong analytical skills to identify trends, patterns, and discrepancies in payroll data. You should also be able to analyze data to make informed decisions about payroll-related issues.* Customer Service Skills: You would need to interact with employees and respond to their inquiries, so you should have excellent customer service skills. You should be able to provide a high level of service to employees and respond to their concerns in a timely and professional manner.JOB REQUIREMENTS* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field* Minimum of 5 years of experience in payroll operations, with at least 3 years in a leadership or managerial role* Strong knowledge of payroll laws and regulations, including taxes and benefits* Experience with payroll software systems, such as ADP, Paychex, or UltiPro* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills* Strong communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment* Excellent experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)WORK ENVIRONMENTWhile performing the responsibilities of this position, the work environment characteristics listed below are representative of the environment the employee will encounter:* Usual office working conditions.PHYSICAL DEMANDS* No physical exertion required.* Travel within or outside of state.* Light work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force as frequently as needed to move objects.TERMS OF EMPLOYMENTSalary and benefits shall be paid consistent with CSUSA salary and benefit policy. Length of the work year and hours of employment shall be those established by Charter Schools USA.FLSA OVERTIME CATEGORYJob is exempt from the overtime provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act.EVALUATIONPerformance will be evaluated in accordance with Charter Schools USA's policy.DECLARATIONThe Charter Schools USA Human Resources Department retains the sole right and discretion to make changes to this job description.
